page.title: 18CONSERVATION IN HARLOW .
page.content: Close to{Harlow}can be found{pollution in the way of rubbish, but the woods by the river were neatly{conserved } until we went further in, where there was barbed wire and razor wire _ very unsightly.Out of the wood,near the A414, some broken stiles were being replaced,others were left broken.The {River Stort}had been dredged so that the water wouldn't break down the banks.Wild bluebells (pink,blue and white) grew by the river and further on were rabbit holes. At{Lodge Farm}the farmer said that deer and partridges were were on his land,together with other wild life. He bred partridges in a pen to protect them in order to replace the birds which had been hunted and shot.Since {Harlow}became a clean air zone he had to pollute the atmosphere by spraying crops with sulphur to help growth.
